solution_line_template: Benny will spend {cost_per_pumpkin_pie} * {num_pumpkin_pies} = $<<{cost_per_pumpkin_pie}*{num_pumpkin_pies}={total_cost_pumpkin_pies}>>{total_cost_pumpkin_pies} to make the pumpkin pies.
He will spend {cost_per_cherry_pie} * {num_cherry_pies} = $<<{cost_per_cherry_pie}*{num_cherry_pies}={total_cost_cherry_pies}>>{total_cost_cherry_pies} to make the cherry pies.

He wants to make a profit of ${desired_profit}, so he has to earn {total_cost_pumpkin_pies} + {total_cost_cherry_pies} + {desired_profit} = $<<{total_cost_pumpkin_pies}+{total_cost_cherry_pies}+{desired_profit}={total_earnings_needed}>>{total_earnings_needed} selling all the pies.
He is making {total_pies_made} pies, so he needs to charge {total_earnings_needed} / {total_pies_made} = $<<{total_earnings_needed}/{total_pies_made}={price_per_pie}>>{price_per_pie} per pie.
